definition: to rain/(of rain, snow etc) to fall/to precipitate/to wet

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
loud thunder, but only tiny drops of rain (idiom); a lot of talk, but no action/action speaks louder than words/his bite is worse than his bark
pinyin: lei2 sheng1 da4 , yu3 dian3 xiao3

sentences.english: The little rain drop slipt from the umbrella to my glasses.
sentences.chinese: 从她伞骨滑下来的小雨点溅在我眼镜玻璃上。

sentences.english: Spots of rain had begun to fall.
sentences.chinese: 稀稀拉拉的雨点开始落下来。

sentences.english: The rain drummed loudly on the metal roof.
sentences.chinese: 雨点敲击金属屋顶，发出很大的声响。

sentences.english: But what about bugs no bigger than the raindrops themselves?
sentences.chinese: 但是比雨点还小的小虫子们，它们的情况怎么样呢？

sentences.english: The tears are just like raindrops.
sentences.chinese: 哗啦啦，小白云的眼泪像雨点。

sentences.english: Presently raindrops the size of peas stared falling.
sentences.chinese: 不久豆粒大的雨点下了起来。

sentences.english: When it rained, funny sounds came from the splashing raindrop on the butterbur leaf.
sentences.chinese: 下雨了，雨点溅在款冬叶子上发出好听的声音。

sentences.english: The missing becomes long-line, penetrates the thick raindrop, arrives at you.
sentences.chinese: 思念连成长线，穿透厚厚的雨点，来到你身边。

sentences.english: Rain rattles the roof and thutters at the window.
sentences.chinese: 雨点落在地面上，拍打着窗户。

sentences.english: He stared at the rain spattering on the glass .
sentences.chinese: 他凝视着雨点溅落在玻璃上。

sentences.english: Bombs rained down on the small village.
sentences.chinese: 炸弹雨点似地落在这个小村庄。

sentences.english: Within a short while larger cloud point and became light rain points.
sentences.chinese: 不一会雾点变大，成了小雨点。

sentences.english: Little rain drops falling from the rib of her umbrella splashed on my glasses.
sentences.chinese: 从她伞骨滑下来的小雨点溅在我眼镜玻璃上。

sentences.english: The windscreen was spotted with rain.
sentences.chinese: 风挡玻璃上布满了雨点。

sentences.english: Fuel was seeping through the joints, raining down on the hangar floor.
sentences.chinese: 燃料从接缝渗出，雨点般落到机棚地上。

definition: a downpour/rain bucketing down/fig. to be overwhelmed (with work or things to study)
howling wind and torrential rain (idiom)/(fig.) difficult, dangerous situation
lit. to fill the whole sky/everywhere/as far as the eye can see
